tweet:
Badging will be a part of the future.
#badgechatk12
Many people are interested in badging and would like to see it happen with both students and teachers. #badgechatk12
The more badging is used, the more teachers/students will want to use.  #badgechatk12

@EMCollins755 @SpaceCampUSA @jbrettjacobsen 
Rocket park looks awesome
Maybe badges could be given to teachers as a type of reward.  Badges do not have to be for skills only.  #badgechatk12

Teachers receive badges for developing own badges in their content. Yes, there could be many badges for teachers.
#badgechatk12
Earning a badge for certain criteria/skills is more meaningful than receiving a grade. #badgechatk12

Skills depend on the class.  I have seen several badges in all contents
#badgechatk12
Developing badges is similar to making an assessment for a project. Students can share the badge where the assessment cannot. #badgechatk12
Once a teacher develops own badge, there is more of a buy-in.  Until you make one for students to earn, one may not like them. #badgechatk12
Criteria is known from the beginning so the students know what is expected to earn the badge.  Great way for an assessment. #badgechatk12
@SenorG We started badges in 5th grade, but teachers are developing badges in their classes. Students can share them instead of assessment.
Badges give the students a sense of responsibility/accountability.  Criteria must be met, no shortcuts,must be earned. #badgechatk12

@katiejcain Hi Katie,
I am Ann Plumer.  I have experienced using badges in class and the students love them. #badgechatk12
@katiejcain I just happened to be on Twitter.  I am excited to participate.
#mvms  Can't wait to see the sights in Washington such as the White House, Lincoln Mem., but esp. Arlington, and much more.
#mvms Twelve hours until we meet at the airport for the 8th grade trip to Washington.
#doslc?  THANK YOU so much to my FRIENDS for joining me tonight.  :)  Thank you!! Thank you!!
@plumersplace @wusylkc I agree.  Even if  1st or 2nd graders, can brag about an accomplishment, it is a beginning.
RT @wusylkc: @plumersplace I agree! I think expectations for leading need to be different from grade to grade #doslc
@plumersplace I think it is a good idea for children to share their work with parents, even if it is only one assignment.
@plumersplace #doslc? Do SLC need to begin in elementary school?  If so, when? #doslc?
doslc? Do SLC's need to begin in elementary school?  If so, what grade?
@wusylkc Fifth graders thought they had to use the script word for word, whereas for 8th graders, it was more natural.
@wusylkc I think age has a lot to do with how the conferences were led.
@AmyMWilkes I believe it was a great learning experience for students, teachers, and parents.  SLC's were much more positive.

@mariegraham I agree. The students used the script as a guideline when they practiced, but all was natural during their SLC.
@katiejcain Looks like some good looking students.  :)
@plumersplace A4 Students do need to be prepared and go over material before sharing just as teachers need to prepare for their classes.
